page.title: 02CHANGE IN THURLASTON -1
page.content: Thurlaston , mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086 as TORLAVESTONE, has had various owners including the Monks of Pipewell in Northamptonshire (13th-16th century).They built a Grange (farm).Four houses have been built on the old moat field ,now Moat Close. Before 1717 strips were cultivated in open fields.Between 1717-1729 enclosure took place as agreed by the Duke of Montagu, Lord of the Manor.This closed the common land cultivated by the villagers.This act caused great hardship but improved agriculture.Farming still remains important in the surrounding area. The village used to grow grapes.The headmaster of Rugby School was a local customer.The stocks in Main Street, used into the 19th century,became delapidated until restored in recent years.
